result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John T Thimm

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John T Thimm in court.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court for John T Thimm.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. State waiting on discovery and will turnover to defense once received. Court VACATES October 21, 2022 status conference. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 04. Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant John T Thimm in court.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court for John T Thimm.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant John T Thimm in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John T Thimm appeared by video means with Attorney.   Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. qCase remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John T Thimm in court in person with Attorney Peter Heflin who appeared by video.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective K. Huck. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Oral No Contact Order with D.J.S

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant John T Thimm in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Defendant John T Thimm in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT RETAIN PRIVATE COUNSEL.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
